text: Is there a better, pythonic way to do this?
This is my first python program -
Requirement: Read a file consisting of {adId UserId} in each line.
For each adId, print the number of unique userIds.
Here is my code, put together from reading the python docs.
Could you give me feedback on how I can write this in more python-ish way?

code:
import csv

adDict = {}
reader = csv.reader(open("some.csv"), delimiter=' ')
for row in reader:
    adId = row[0]
    userId = row[1]
    if ( adId in adDict ):
        adDict[adId].add(userId)
    else:
        adDict[adId] = set(userId)

for key, value in adDict.items():
    print (key, ',' , len(value))
